Content:
Hi All,
I‚Äôm looking for some advice. We have an employee that recently found out they are on the autism spectrum. They have not formally notified HR but recently have been noting their new status at every opportunity, even with customers over the phone, which has brought up concerns about appearances. I‚Äôm assuming some kind of intent and would like to address the comments with the employee to find out more about the situation. What would you do? How would you address the situation?
summarize: The key topic is how to address an employee's disclosure of being on the autism spectrum and their behavior of mentioning it frequently, even with customers.

Content:
Very close to pull the trigger to take 2-3 years off to be a SAHM. Wanted to see the thoughts.
Reasons:
1: have 2 kids (7 and 4). The younger one has modest autism. It has been very challenging to get him to sit and eat on the table and just to be more independent in general so wanted to spend more time there.
2: we have ~3mm net worth now and husband typically makes 500k or more as a limited partner in a small company so financially we are probably ok
See below for concerns
summarize: The main topic is considering taking time off to be a stay-at-home mom due to family reasons and financial stability.

Content: I‚Äôve been crying for the last hour and can‚Äôt seem to stop. My 26-year-old daughter was diagnosed with autism and ADHD and is currently in therapy, which is helping her. However, we talked to her therapist earlier tonight and he told us that ‚Äúdevelopmentally‚Äù she‚Äôs 17. I‚Äôm so upset because no mother wants their child to struggle in life, and obviously also because we never even considered anything like this when she was younger. We had no clue. I just feel so bad for her and for not knowing.
summarize: The key topic is the emotional struggle of a mother whose 26-year-old daughter has been diagnosed with autism and ADHD and is developmentally at the age of 17.

Content:

Content:

Quitting my job means having to move out of the area (FAR out of the area) because we couldn't afford to stay here. But then my child would lose the few friends they have. I'm so torn.

Content: Does your firm address neurodiversity as part of its DEI program? I think it would be helpful and even life changing for those who are yet unaware of their own neurodiversity.
summarize: The key topic is the inclusion of neurodiversity in DEI programs and the need for awareness and acceptance of autism spectrum in the legal community.

Content:

Content: You wrote: "Does anyone else with Autism and/or ADHD working in a corporate office feel so out of place?" Corporate offices are generally not designed for neurodivergent people. summarize: The main topic is the challenges faced by neurodivergent individuals in corporate offices and the need for accommodations to work productively.

Content: Normally I'm not super sensitive but it bothers me how people misuse medical conditions as slurs or jokes, especially in the office. OCD is not a cutesy description. Content: I‚Äôve worked with two therapists and a psychiatrist. The therapists I worked with for 3 months and 4 months. The psych I saw for an hour. They diagnosed me with PTSD and Bipolar Disorder. I‚Äôm no psych expert but I was a little shocked at that. Is that normal to diagnose someone with that after just one hour? Yes, I‚Äôm anxious. Ever since I was a kid. And am now in depression but never would have categorized myself as BPD. I have a job, I‚Äôve paid down my student loans from 5 figures to 4 and will
summarize: The main topic is the author's experience with mental health professionals and their diagnosis of PTSD and Bipolar Disorder after a short evaluation.

Content: Have you ever had to work with another co worker in your area who is repeatedly lazy and difficult? I work in a big chain store and the guy I work with in my area has been there 20 years. Ive been there 1.5 years. This guy is bipolar & negative nancy all day long which I try to avoid by ignoring .He is also very lazy and takes ages to get anything done. We share 3 isles and have to put stock away, ticketing/ pricing and help with making displays. I think about leaving all day long. Very tiring!
summarize: The key topic is dealing with a difficult and lazy co-worker in a retail job.

Content: Feeling unsupported by lifelong friends. I suffer from bipolar depression (they know this), and will say things like ‚Äúwhatever you need, let us know, we‚Äôre family, we‚Äôre here for you‚Äù etc. but when I actually need something, often at inconvenient times, they are nowhere to be found. I really need one of my friends to come see me on Xmas eve or Xmas day, even if for just 1 hr., but they can‚Äôt be bothered. If the shoe was on the other foot, I would likely be there in a heartbeat.
summarize: The key topic is feeling unsupported by lifelong friends despite their promises to be there for someone with bipolar depression.

Content: This job is making me bipolar - last week felt on top of the world (connected, competent, valued) and today I feel overwhelmed, burnt out, like a failure.
summarize: The main topic is the negative impact of a job on mental health, specifically bipolar disorder.

Content: Inspired by the other post here. How open are you with colleagues about mental illness, depression, and all that? I have bipolar II and I hide it from people because I feel it's none of their business, but a white associate just admitted to me at lunch that they have it. I wanted to share that I did too but I hesitated because you know...twice as hard. But should I?
summarize: The main topic is discussing whether or not to disclose one's mental illness to colleagues in the workplace.

Content: Someone help me to understand, I am a Army Veteran, 44 years old, and a mother of 6. I suffer from PTSD. Severe manic bipolar depression, and severe anxiety. I have been with this man for almost 13 years. He is a narcissistic, bipolar Hispanic man who loves to belittle me, make fun of me, put me down in ways that you would never believe, and has a tendency to hurt me just to make his self feel more like a man. I don't know how to get free safely. I'm so scared and extremely unhappy. Help pls
summarize: The key topic is domestic abuse and the struggle to escape from an abusive partner.

Content: I unfortunately think I have issues related to mental health and cognitive abilities. I failed a few classes in college due to Generalized Anxiety Disorder but now I‚Äôm starting to think I have something bigger like bipolar disorder, or ADHD, or some form of autism. Is there a specialist who can help me get tested for these issues?
summarize: The main topic is seeking help for mental health and cognitive issues, including the possibility of having bipolar disorder, ADHD, or autism.

Content: Hi all, I have a similar question on the hearing God's voice thing. I actually have struggled for many years with bipolar and whenever I have a manic episode, which unfortunately happened very recently again when we changed some things with my medication, I feel that I hear God and also the devil in different ways and I'm so convinced and then it all comes crashing down when I finally get help and move out of the episode. And my faith is shaken. Would appreciate any prayer or wisdom you have.
summarize: The main topic is struggling with hearing God's voice during manic episodes caused by bipolar disorder.

Content: I have no sense of smell, I'm deaf, I'm blind in right eye, Im diabetic, I have arthritis in all my joints. I am autistic and bipolar, I have anxiety, depression, PTSD, OCD, ADHD. I have learning disabilities. I'm not good with technology or interacting with other. I can't stand on my feet all day. I've been unemployed for about 8 months. I was in the fast food/restaurant industry for about 10 years but I was constantly job hopping every year cuz it's not a good job field for me.
summarize: The main topic is the various physical and mental health challenges faced by the individual, which have impacted their employment opportunities.

Content: I have a choice of retiring now and receiving a junior developer‚Äôs wage for life from social security or working again. I have bipolar 1, and I keep losing jobs for ‚Äúacting weird:‚Äù 21 jobs lost in 16 years. I am tempted to take the Social Security Disability Income as a result. Does anyone else have a better idea?
summarize: The main topic is the dilemma of choosing between retiring and receiving social security or continuing to work despite losing jobs due to bipolar disorder.

Content:
I‚Äôm new to copywriting, and my 3rd interview was likely to see if I ‚Äúvibe‚Äù with the team (not creatives - all strat) because they loved my writing assignment. The issue is that I‚Äôm bipolar + ADHD. I don‚Äôt mask well when anxious, so my words get away from me. I always think I‚Äôm kicking ass (well hello grandiosity), but often times‚Ä¶cringe. My dream is to be the guy in The Big Short who‚Äôs so good at his job that no one cares that he lacks social grace.

They said by end of day Friday. Well.
summarize: The main topic is the challenges faced by a new copywriter with bipolar disorder and ADHD during a job interview.

Content: I am really struggling on focusing at work. Does anyone have advice on adult diagnoses, multiple overlapping diagnoses, or misdiagnoses? I was diagnosed with bipolar and anxiety disorder about 15 years ago. I always did very well in school but looking back, I always had to learn to do things ‚Äúmy way.‚Äù Like, I had coping strategies for learning new topics or doing homework. In a way, the diagnoses and labels don‚Äôt matter-more about feeling regulated and able to be successful in life.
summarize: The main topic is the struggle with focusing at work and seeking advice on adult diagnoses, multiple overlapping diagnoses, or misdiagnoses.

Content: I have bipolar that isn't currently well managed & I messed up. I said somethings to a couple members of team I lead I shouldn't have. At a minimum damaged trust & showed very bad judgement, so inappropriate for that, but not demeaning, derogatory, or insulting etc but definitely wrong. HR is involved & as routine legal. I'm not sure how much I've screwed myself, or how to protect myself, or what recourse I may have if the worst happens. I've needed help for a while but hadn't asked before now,
summarize: The key topic is an individual with bipolar disorder who made inappropriate comments to team members and is now facing potential consequences and seeking help.

Content: I can only say please nobody apply to work on the optical center named eye contact vision center ‚Ä¶ the owner is a bipolar person that will only takes you serious if you dress half naked will make your days miserable and will underpay you ‚Ä¶. I can only say I needed therapy after working for this man !!!
summarize: The key topic is the negative work experience and mistreatment by the owner of Eye Contact Vision Center.

Content: I have an aunt who is bipolar although I am not I was always told don‚Äôt be like her every time I get upset. As an adult I‚Äôm very aware of mental illness and question if she is is even bipolar or was it everyone just saying she was all those years putting her in a corner. She had a lot of life happen to her and many reasons to get upset be depressed and even rage out.
summarize: The main topic is questioning the accuracy of a bipolar diagnosis and the impact of societal stigma on mental illness.

Content: Living with bipolar disorder sucks especially when you come from an Asian American household that doesn‚Äôt believe in mental health - you can Google this it‚Äôs a toxic culture. I have a lot saved up so I can buy treatment n my own dime now no idea how I‚Äôd deal with it as someone depending on my parents. Good luck to those out there who need help message me if you need it.
summarize: The main topic is the challenges of living with bipolar disorder in an Asian American household that does not believe in mental health.

Content: ‚ÄúThis world is bipolar, beautiful for some for others the fuckin' saddest‚Äù
summarize: The main topic is the duality of the world and how it can be perceived differently by different people.

Content: Mental Health Therapist specializing in PTSD, BiPolar, Anxiety, Depression, and more to assist in the healing and minimizing of different aspects of mental health to maximize the growth for positive and productive outcomes.
summarize: The key topic is mental health therapy for various conditions such as PTSD, bipolar disorder, anxiety, and depression to promote positive outcomes.

Content:
Can anyone tell me if Hampton House Cherryhill NJ or Princeton House House, Moorsetown is better for virtual IOP with DBT or CBT or both for a 66 year old male with Bipolar? He is compliant with medication but treatment resistant. Hampton Hospital, last year so 2022 kept pointing me away from their own IOP. That raised my antenni.

Thoughts? Help Advice?
summarize: The main topic is seeking advice on which virtual IOP program (DBT or CBT) is better for a 66-year-old male with Bipolar who is treatment resistant.

Content: I really hate struggling with bipolar disorder. When I‚Äôm in a hypomanic state, I feel SO good. I feel like that‚Äôs the real me. And then when it‚Äôs over, I find myself mourning that time. The depression hits so much harder after the mania.
summarize: The main topic is living with bipolar disorder and the challenges of managing the contrasting states of hypomania and depression.

Content: Ive dealt with anxiety and major depression and bipolar issues for the last ten years. I just turned 30 and it's kept me from keeping a full time job, so Ive hoped jobs a lot the last 6 years. I've only been in Columbus for 5 years the only family or person I know is my grandmother. I haven't worked in maybe a Year now but I'm finally ready too, I've had a lot of help to do it. But now I can't find a job and making all the work I have done useless. I just want to work please any help or advice.
summarize: The main topic is the struggle of finding a job while dealing with mental health issues.

Content: I am seeking people with Bipolar 1 for an article I‚Äôm writing. You may stay anonymous, if you wish. The goal of the piece is to help others understand the condition, as well as share treatments that have worked for you and may help others.
summarize: The main topic is seeking individuals with Bipolar 1 to share their experiences and treatments for an article aimed at helping others understand the condition.

Content: I suffer with anxiety everyday and diagnosed. It's hard . Practicing meditation , deep breathing, and take my medicine. If anyone have more tools that would be nice.
summarize: The main topic is coping with anxiety and seeking additional tools for managing it.

Content: Am I a failure if I leave big law because of my anxiety issues, I‚Äôm trying to fight through it but even have anxiety opening emails.
summarize: The key topic is anxiety issues in the context of leaving a big law job.

Content: To all the consultants who were laid off and still searching, there's still hope. I was laid off by PwC last year and was unemployeed for over a year, with a family of 3 children to feed. I have applied for 300+ roles, with 20+ interviews and 5 final rounds all being rejected. There were so many sleepless nights, self-doubt, anxiety attack, and just total despairity. Today, I finally got an offer from my dream company in tech,with 20% TC raise and potentially much better WLB. (cont. in comment)
summarize: The main topic is the experience of being laid off as a consultant and the hope for finding a new job.

Content: Does anyone here who‚Äôs job searching while being unemployed feels anxiety on weekends? I got laid off last month and Friday evenings and weekends are really hard for me. The rejection emails start pouring from Friday evening and I know that I won‚Äôt get any interview updates or feedback over the weekend. There‚Äôs also not much to study as after interviewing for so long you already know the answers to most questions. In short, I just feel terrible on weekends and wonder if this is normal?
summarize: The primary topic is the anxiety experienced by job seekers who are unemployed, particularly on weekends, due to the lack of job updates and the influx of rejection emails.

Content:
SM yelled at me for not responding to a weekend email until Monday (on a normal weekend with no expectation to be available). I mean *yelled* at me and said some pretty disrespectful things. I have never had a negative review or issue like this ever.

Is it worth saying anything? Is there a way to bring this up with someone without it becoming a problem for me? I feel a lot of anxiety about being around him and about the project now.
summarize: The key topic is workplace harassment and how to address it.

Content: I am horrible at interviewing to the point I want to cry when it‚Äôs over. I‚Äôve tried everything to be better but my anxiety takes over. I always do well in my roles. I am a faster learner and have never had any issues with performance or producing quality work. I am an extrovert. I‚Äôm outgoing & get along with everyone . But when it comes to interviews it‚Äôs like I become a different person. My brain shuts down, my personality doesn‚Äôt come out. Anyone have these experiences when interviewing?
summarize: The main topic is the difficulty of interviewing due to anxiety and the struggle to showcase one's personality during the process.

Content: Question for those of you who have depression and /or anxiety? How do you cope? I have done everything. Anti depressants, radio therapy, meditation, workouts, journaling, stupid walks. It seems to have gotten worse. Nothing sticks and that makes life and work v tough. Anything worked for you in the long term?
summarize: The main topic is coping strategies for individuals with depression and anxiety.

Content: Has anyone left big law without a job lined up? How did you land on your feet again? (For context: I‚Äôm a 2nd/3rd at a v10 firm and from a T5 law school; no family money and have loans. I‚Äôm having anxiety/panic attacks because of work and just don‚Äôt want to live like this anymore. No time to search for job while working.) summarize: The main topic is leaving a big law firm without a job lined up and finding a new job.

Content: I make $225k. Am too anxious all the time. We just had our second kid. Coming back to work after my leave, i feel sick to stomach. Content: Meeting my 3 monthly quotas has become a little challenging lately and I started having issues with my employer for the past 4 months primarily with my VP who has been giving me a form of emotional abuse on my weekly one on one .I feel Ive being nit picked at by him. summarize: The key topic is workplace harassment and emotional abuse leading to PTSD and anxiety.

Content: Senior associate in big law. For the longest time, I struggled with imposter syndrome, wondering if I had the chops to cut it at my firm. Work has been so incredibly busy and stressful that I finally came to a realization. It‚Äôs not that I CAN‚ÄôT cut it ‚Äî it‚Äôs that I don‚Äôt WANT to. I am so sick and tired of spending every single hour of my life stressed, working every weekend, not spending time with my husband, throwing up every day because of my anxiety, and crying about my self worth.
summarize: The main topic is burnout and work-life balance in the legal profession.

Content: Is it really bad manners to not have your camera on in team meetings if other members have their‚Äôs on? What if you have extreme anxiety?
summarize: The key topic is whether it is considered bad manners to not have your camera on during team meetings when others do, and how anxiety may play a role in this decision.

Content: My 12 yr old (M, 6th grade) hasn't been himself lately (~4-5 mos). Complaining of stomach aches, not interacting w/friends, not getting work done, etc. Last night he broke down in tears and after over an hour of talking I learned how much negative self-talk he has in his head, how low his confidence is, and how much anxiety he has (which I think is manifesting in physical symptoms). My heart completely broke because he is a smart, funny, and kind. How can I best support him and help him? Cont.
summarize: The key topic is a 12-year-old boy's mental health struggles, including negative self-talk, low confidence, and anxiety, and how to best support and help him.

Content: Welp just put in my two weeks notice because of the RTO mandate at omnicom I don't have anything lined up yet, but I couldn't deal with the constant anxiety attacks of commuting and open offices.

Content: Does anyone have any interview Tips? I haven‚Äôt interviewed in over 10 years and not only do I feel rusty but also I noticed my anxiety is over the roof, I get so stressed and nervous that I freeze and forget what I was going to say. Any advice?
summarize: The key topic is "Interview Tips".

Content: I can‚Äôt stop crying. Another year has ended and still no friends, unemployed due to a RIF and 60 pounds overweight. The past 5 years have just been a spiral down. Single and no family. I am not going to harm myself but I honestly don‚Äôt know how to pull myself out. Finding a good therapist is almost impossible and expensive. summarize: The main topic is the individual's struggles with loneliness, unemployment, weight gain, and mental health issues.

Content:
I feel like I constantly put my foot in my mouth at work, I love to joke around and have fun and honestly use humor to cope most days but I can‚Äôt beat the social anxiety when I feel like something I say doesn‚Äôt land.

I‚Äôm extremely young (23F) in a professional career and my team is great, but I just can‚Äôt kick the feeling of caring too much what everyone thinks about me.

How did you all combat this at my age? I‚Äôm growing every day but some days are two steps back.
summarize: The main topic is social anxiety and the struggle to balance humor and professionalism in a young professional career.

Content: MIL wants my child to stay with her out of state for a week this summer. I‚Äôve never been away from him from him that long or that far from him ~1000 miles. He is five. I‚Äôm also 21 weeks pregnant and extra emotional. Should I let him go and just suck it up and deal with my anxiety??
summarize: The key topic is whether a mother should allow her five-year-old child to stay with their grandmother out of state for a week during the summer, despite the mother's anxiety and being 21 weeks pregnant.

Content: Why is it so hard to find a job right now? I‚Äôve been unemployed for 6 months. I applied to over 300 jobs and maybe a good 10 reached out. Content:
How do you all shed the stress of a work day? I have seen too many people carry their work stress home with them, and it just makes them miserable.

Also, how do you deal with anxiety?
summarize: The key topic is stress management and anxiety coping strategies.

Content: I am hitting 31 (F) in a month and I am starting to get serious anxiety about my life trajectory especially on a personal/romantic level. I find myself recycling old dates/people I didn‚Äôt give a serious chance to because I feel like things are only gonna get more difficult from here on in and that I have passed my prime. I don‚Äôt want to sound traditional/backwards thinking, but I feel like that ship has sailed for me and all I am left with is the scraps ü•π
summarize: The main topic is the anxiety and fear of a 31-year-old woman about her personal and romantic life trajectory, feeling like she has passed her prime and has limited options.

Content:
For those of you on the fence about going in-house, I want to share the following, having recently made the switch myself:

Words cannot describe what a colossal difference not billing has made for my quality of life. I am now able to actually enjoy my slow days, evenings, and weekends without anxiety or the feeling of ‚Äúfalling behind.‚Äù No longer concerned about ‚Äúcatching up‚Äù after a day of suboptimal productivity, half-ass vacation, or taking time to go to the dentist.

(Cont. in comments)
summarize: The main topic is the benefits of transitioning from a law firm to an in-house legal position, particularly the improved quality of life due to not having to bill hours.

Content: The increased number of school shootings really has me concerned about safety and it's hard not to think about it during the workday. I love my job but I also can't sustain the anxiety forever. Does anyone else worry about this and if so, how do you calm your nerves?
summarize: The primary topic is the concern about safety in schools due to the increased number of school shootings and how to manage the resulting anxiety.

Content: I have a coworker that is constantly causing anxiety and distress in myself and others. The problem is all the interactions, at face value, are ‚Äúprofessional‚Äù. But anyone that reads the messages or hears about the interaction can see her tone is unnecessarily mean. Is there anything that can be done about her behavior?!

Content: I have been unemployed since April this year; been busting my butt applying, interviewing, and talking to many recruiters, and still nothing. summarize: The main topic is unemployment and the challenges and emotional toll it can bring.

Content: Y‚Äôall!!! I got the job! My boss is out of town and I sent in my notice to the VP and copied her and HR! I have so much anxiety it‚Äôs insane. I‚Äôm so happy I am leaving.
summarize: The key topic is the author's excitement about getting a new job and leaving their current one.

Content: Made the fatal mistake of giving my personal number to my boss, who now calls and texts me for non urgent matters multiple times a day, every day, including weekends. Content: How has insurance affected your mental health? I have more anxiety than ever before.
summarize: The key topic is the impact of insurance on mental health, specifically the increase in anxiety.

Content: Hi all, I‚Äôm suffering. Rejection after rejection after rejection and my anxiety has never been worse. It‚Äôs been 7 months since my layoff, and I‚Äôve never felt worse in my life. I feel the light is becoming dimmer and dimmer.
summarize: The key topic is job rejection and its impact on mental health.

Content: I just moved here from Europe. Why is the American corporate culture rooted so much around escalating people‚Äôs mistakes to mangers, placing them on PIP etc? The lack of empathy is so disheartening man, we are all here to make money. And regarding sustaining a high performing team‚Ä¶this is not your father‚Äôs company, neither is it theirs. One day we will all move on from this job and even from this life. Is the most important thing really to cause anxiety and fear to someone for making mistakes?
summarize: The key topic is the American corporate culture's emphasis on escalating mistakes to managers and lack of empathy towards employees.

Content: As a parent of a toddler, between work, and parenting, I don't have much left to fill my cup. Took 2 days off and ended up having panic attack because I could not keep work anxiety away. Husband is an equal partner but I am struggling to truly rest and recharge. An anyone relate or have suggestions
summarize: The main topic is the struggle of a working parent to find time to rest and recharge while dealing with work anxiety and exhaustion.

Content: Middle aged woman here (SM) and absolutely hate my job. Severe anxiety, high stress and burnout means I have nothing left to give. Thankful I still have a job in this season of layoffs but I‚Äôve NO strength left to work another week here. Been applying like crazy to get out. Made it to final round of two different roles only to be told I wasn‚Äôt the best fit. Latest job rejection has hit me like a ton of bricks. Couldnt get out of bed for a day. Any advice on how to cope and resume job hunt?
summarize: The main topic is job dissatisfaction, anxiety, burnout, and difficulty finding a new job.

Content: Company made us come back to the office full time. Recently they converted cubicles into a massive open office setting with no assigned seats. We have to fight for seats every day/deal with coworkers on loud calls, eating, gossiping... sensory overload nightmare. A few colleagues got notes from doctors saying they have anxiety or other issues that prevent them from working in this environment and are able to WFH. I want to do the same but don't have any conditions.... unethical for me to lie?
summarize: The key topic is the challenges and issues faced by employees in a newly converted open office setting and the ethical dilemma of lying to work from home.

Content: Is it just me feeling this but when sunday hits,, i start to have my Sunday-itis. That feeling if anxiety, cant sleep.. knowing that have to go back to work on Monday.. üòí how can i balance work and life. What do you guys do?
summarize: The main topic is work-life balance and coping with the anxiety of returning to work on Monday.

Content: My daughter, for whatever reason, is terrified of large dogs. She never had a bad experience and we are fine with dogs but she is scared even with the friendliest of pooches. My in laws want to get a new dog to replace their old German Shepard rescue. The last dog had a ton of anxiety, nipped my MIL several times and could not be trusted around anyone new. They had to board it every time we came over. We asked them to consider getting a smaller dog and perhaps a puppy that they could train‚Ä¶
summarize: The key topic is the fear of large dogs and the suggestion to consider getting a smaller, trainable dog.

Posted By: a Service Quality, Risk, and Compliance Specialist II
Content: I am on verge of getting terminated. I was issued a charge sheet a week ago and I couldn't sleep or eat properly since then. it was just a minor mistake that I wasn't given a chance to defend myself during enquiry. They called me in and asked me everything suddenly and they issued me a charge sheet. I started to get depressed and anxiety is taking a toll over me. I want to commit suicide but I want to live for my parents. I don't know what to do, I don't know whether I can find a job again or no
summarize: The key topic is an employee facing termination and struggling with depression and anxiety as a result.

Content:
Have you ever had a job that sucked your soul?
You just felt like a ball of anxiety on the drive in.

I get it.
My last job was like that.
I was underutilized, unrecognized, & underpaid.

I was crabby all the time.
But that wasn't the real me.

After I found my place in the world,
I became a different person.
I looked forward to my job- every. single.day.

So if you're at the end of your rope:
You're not alone.

Give yourself room to grow in a new space.
You may just be surprised at the results.
summarize: The main topic is finding a fulfilling job and overcoming a negative work experience.

Content: I‚Äôve always exceeded expectations. I became a ‚Äúlow performer‚Äù this year. They want too much from a one-person team. I‚Äôve never experienced anxiety or panic attacks until now. I work 70-80 hour weeks. I am 100% burnt out. I am looking and plan to leave even for less. I can‚Äôt sleep or focus and it‚Äôs taking a toll on my health. I really need to take a leave. Should I? I feel like the first day back would be my last if I do. Or do I stick it out, look for a job and wait for my severance package?
summarize: The key topic is burnout and job dissatisfaction.

Content: If you had to choose, would you go with a guy who only got into 1 college he applied for, doesn't make much money and probably never will, has all kinds of depression and anxiety issues that require a cocktail of antidepressants to deal with but comes from a loving family, and really cares about you and is honest and consistent or with another guy who had a good job, makes good money and happily spends it on you but dabbles with cocaine (but is disciplined enough to avoid real addiction)?
summarize: The key topic is choosing between a partner with mental health issues but who is loving and consistent versus a partner with a good job and money but who dabbles with cocaine.

Content: Lately I've been feeling anxiety that I'm going to get fired from my job. Haven't done anything wrong whatsoever, but my anxiety has taken over and every time an email comes through, I think "is this the day I'm packing my things in a box?" I think I just need a break to recuperate. üòÆ‚Äçüí®
summarize: The main topic is job insecurity and anxiety related to the fear of being fired.

Content: Lately I've been feeling anxiety that I'm going to get fired from my job. Content:

Content:

A simple act of receiving a rejection email can save your candidates' feelings of agony and uncertainty. It's time to set the highest standard possible for how you engage with your candidates and ground it in respect

Content:
Depression and anxiety are two of the most common mental health conditions that affect millions of people worldwide. They can have a profound impact on a person's quality of life, relationships, and overall well-bein

Depression

- Is a mood disorder that can cause feelings of sadness, hopelessness, and a loss of interest in activities that once brought joy

Anxiety:
- Is a normal human emotion that can become a disorder when it becomes excess

Remember, mental health,seeking help is strength.

Content:
Dear Companies,

Let's humanize the hiring process. Rejection is far better, and much more humane, than silence. Candidates spend hours crafting the perfect resume, rehearsing and preparing for the interview, and then waiting with anxiety and hope that they may get the job.

Content:
Struggling with my ADHD and anxiety (aren‚Äôt we all?)
Recently I have had problems with trying to start new tasks or complete others I have begun. Content:
Tips for successfully working with severe ADHD
1) Go into the office every single day (if you need quiet book an office, if you benefit from feeling like you're being watched book an open space)
2) Leave your phone in your car
3) Break projects into smaller parts
4) Give each part a deadline, put that deadline for that part in your calendar and confirm the deadline for each part with your mgr via email so it's more concrete than telling them
5) Take a break to walk every few hours
summarize: The key topic is tips for successfully working with severe ADHD, including strategies such as breaking projects into smaller parts, setting deadlines, and taking breaks to walk.

Content:
Prescribed Ridalin for ADHD. In two months, my blood pressure skyrocketed to 185/127 from 90/60. My PCP caught it in my checkup and told me I was in the danger zone for a heart attack. Was going to happen any day now. Stopped taking Ritalin and switched to non-stimulant ADHD medication, and it returned to 90/60 in 4 weeks.

Please be careful taking stimulant ADHD medication. üôèüèæStay safe and healthy all. üôèüèæ
summarize: The key topic is the potential danger of taking stimulant ADHD medication and its impact on blood pressure.

Content: Lesson from my ADHD coach 2: Write your to do list, then assign each task with an energy level 1-10. This could reflect the actual energy required, but more importantly reflects the emotional energy required and resistance to doing it. Then take tasks with energy greater than 5 and break it down until the energy required is low enough to be achievable. Then gamify to see how quickly i can get it done. Trick is to take the emotion/overwhelm out of vague tasks by creating a structured process
summarize: The main topic is a structured process for managing tasks and overcoming emotional resistance, specifically for individuals with ADHD.

Content: I feel like CVS systematically discriminates against folks with ADHD. My prescriber will call in my prescription early with a hold to comply with the 30 day supply regulation. Content:
Young (25) consultant with ADHD struggling to be consistent at work.

CW: Depression

My ADHD and depression get me very down quite regularly (at minimum 1-2 days a week). I'll be MIA (I WFH) and get behind, and them I'll be even more depressed because I'm letting coworkers down.

I'll get a random good day/few days where I get a ton done and am super excited that maybe this is the moment I'll now be on track like everyone else. But then my burst wears me out and then repeat.

cont. below
summarize: The key topic is a young consultant with ADHD struggling to be consistent at work and experiencing depression as a result.

Content: Does it seem like we're all just getting by? Is anyone thriving? Seems like I'm too busy and then too tired to achieve the professional and personal goals I really want. Anxiety. Check. Depression. Check. ADHD. Maybe? Are any other millennials/gen z-ers feeling it this hard?

Content:

Content: A hard part of my ADHD is that I have a hard time keeping track my personal belongings. Content: ADHD and ChatGPT. What I‚Äôve learned. For example, I‚Äôll have ChatGPT read and edit emails for ‚Äúdiplomacy‚Äù so I don‚Äôt come off as an asshole. Or help structure my thoughts into a coherent outline. Lastly I‚Äôll use it to help create project and task outlines to keep me on track.
summarize: The main topic is how ChatGPT has helped the author overcome common roadblocks associated with their ADHD, such as time blindness, unwritten social rules, task initiation, and executive function.

Content:

Content:

Content: I suffer from ADHD/anxiety/depression. Started a new job 2 years ago, 2 weeks before starting my dad died. After a few months, I needed an ADA accommodation: 2 office days not 3. After 6 months, they made me redo my accommodations. Now, they require 3 days and little flexiblity compared to others. Only accommodations they offered was to move me away from my team or sit in a conference room by myself. I have never taken leave and I'm afraid. I just want out. I know not everywhere is like this.
summarize: The main topic is workplace accommodations for an employee with ADHD/anxiety/depression and the challenges they faced in obtaining and maintaining them.

Content: Known something was wrong with me as far back as I can remember - some exceptional abilities (STEM), but serious deficits (social skills, sensory processing, attention). Mostly thrived in my career with people who tolerated my quirks when they saw what I could do. Tentatively diagnosed with Asperger's in 2001, but there was no info or help. High Functioning Autism sort of confirmed ~2018, plus ADHD inattentive and depression. Employer denied accommodation request, laid me off 2020...
summarize: The main topic is the challenges faced by an individual with Asperger's, High Functioning Autism, ADHD, and depression in the workplace, including the denial of accommodation requests and subsequent layoff.

Content: With media jobs like video editing facing a tenuous future from both AI and mass outsourcing, I am wondering about a pivot. summarize: The key topic is exploring alternative career options for individuals with ADHD due to the uncertain future of media jobs.

Content: So I have a degree in cybersecurity, and I am undertaking a coding bootcamp , I can‚Äôt get a job due to a criminal record In the cybersecurity field, but I‚Äôm very good at what I do, I have ADHD and Autism which was diagnosed at a late stage of my life but it explains the transgressions earlier on in my life . summarize: The main topic is the individual's struggle to find employment in the tech industry due to a criminal record and neurodivergent conditions.

Content: You wrote: "Does anyone else with Autism and/or ADHD working in a corporate office feel so out of place?" Corporate offices are generally not designed for neurodivergent people. You have the right to ask for what you need to work productively. Check out the work of Ludmila N. Praslova- https://hbr.org/2021/12/autism-doesnt-hold-people-back-at-work-discrimination-does
summarize: The main topic is the challenges faced by neurodivergent individuals in corporate offices and the need for accommodations to work productively.

Content:

Content: Normally I'm not super sensitive but it bothers me how people misuse medical conditions as slurs or jokes, especially in the office. OCD is not a cutesy description. Content:

Content:
Has anyone done a neuropsych eval?

My PCP recommended one, as I've been on Lexapro and adderall for ADHD, but still feeling down, rarely excited or happy, and sometimes foggy.

Sounds like he wants a more comprehensive picture of what the primary issue is: anxiety, depression, or ADHD to guide any medication changes.

My hesitation is it sounds expensive. Family members in the field wonder if a switch to Wellbutrin or more adderall, I'm only on 10mg/day, would be a quicker cheaper fix..
summarize: The key topic is whether to undergo a neuropsychological evaluation to determine the primary issue of anxiety, depression, or ADHD and guide medication changes, versus considering alternative medication options.

Content:
Depression and anxiety are two of the most common mental health conditions that affect millions of people worldwide. They can have a profound impact on a person's quality of life, relationships, and overall well-bein

Depression

- Is a mood disorder that can cause feelings of sadness, hopelessness, and a loss of interest in activities that once brought joy

Anxiety:
- Is a normal human emotion that can become a disorder when it becomes excess

Remember, mental health,seeking help is strength.

Content:
You don‚Äôt have to feel grateful to be grateful

November is World Gratitude Month. But gratitude isn't always easy. And that‚Äôs okay. When stress strikes, burnout bites, or depression looms, it‚Äôs not always helpful to force yourself to feel grateful. So take the pressure off.

Authentic gratitude only comes when you honor where you‚Äôre at anyway ‚Äî even if that‚Äôs sad or mad or lonely.

So here‚Äôs permission to *not* feel grateful this month. Feel however you‚Äôre feeling.
summarize: The main topic is the importance of authentic gratitude and the permission to not feel grateful during World Gratitude Month.

Content:
"With a good perspective on history, we can have a better understanding of the past and present, and thus a clear vision of the future."

It's far too easy for investors to lose perspective. Whenever something big goes wrong, a lot of people panic and sell their investments. Looking at history, the markets recovered from the 2008 financial crisis, the dotcom crash, and even the Great Depression, so they'll probably get through whatever comes next as well.
summarize: The key topic is the importance of historical perspective in understanding and navigating financial markets.
